title: BACnetClientRestoreBACnetDevice (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK PUBLIC FINAL BACnetClientRestoreBACnetDevice EXTENDS
BACnetClientBase
Common Behaviour Model conform (ETrigA) FB to initiates a restore procedure for an BACnet device.
If execution completed successfully and xDone is TRUE, the request was successful.
In any other case eStatus and errorResult may hold additional information of what failed.

rows.Name: xExecute
rows.Comment: Rising edge: Starts defined operationFALSE: Resets the defined operation after ready condition was reached

rows:
Max. operating time for executing
[Âµs], 0: No operating time limit

rows.Name: dwTargetDeviceNumber
rows.Comment:
The device number of the targeted device in the BACnet-
Network.

rows:
Optional: The device address of the targeted device in the BACnet-Network. If
an adress is given the given device number is ignored.

A pointer to the structure which contains a set of APDU properties to control the
timing and size of transmitted frames for this request. It temporarily overwrites the
global APDU settings made in the source device from which this request is sent and which
parameters would control this request if this pointer is NULL.

rows.Name: eStatus
rows.Comment: If an error occured, the error state.

rows:
If an error occured (this means eStatus <> BACNET_STATUS_OK), whereas the sent BACnet-Request was answered
with an specific error information, the latter is contained in this structure.

The State in which the FB is during execution:0: No execution, resetted state1: Searching for the Target-Device and a valid address for it2: Sending the BACnet-Request into the network3: Waiting for the answer (if there is one) to the BACnet-Request made in 24: Finishing the call, setting of the output variables

rows.Name: deviceInstance
rows.Comment: The device instance number to restore.

rows:
The optional password needed for the restore procedure.
If no password is needed for this procedure set the string type to
BACNET_STRING_NONE.

The path to the storage location of file object data
received.

An event-callback interface to inform about failures
and progress information during the procedure execution.
